author: andreas
content: Flo, a polarizer can only get rid of reflections when you look at the reflecting surface from an angle other than 90 degrees, i.e. you don't look straight at it. And even then, the scene is not a single point. You look at it from more than one angle, but a polarizer can only completely remove reflections from one single angle. It's great to remove most of those reflections in a real scene, but it can't remove all of them. In other words: it does not work here ðŸ™‚
